com.uttt.common.board

Interface Playable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Board, Position

    public interface Playable
    Within a UTTT Board, objects that implement Playable represent parts of the game board where a player move may be made. As such, Playable objects either are Board objects, or are objects that reference a (single) Board. Also, since a Playable always has a Board associated with it, that Board must always have a Position (where a null position is defined to mean the top-board of the game.

    In general, a {cod Playable} object either is a Board or refers to one, and either is a Position or has one. These are called the "associated board" and "associate position," respectively.

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      int getHeight()

      boolean isPlayable()
      Return true iff the associated Position refers to an open token spot, or an open board.

      • isPlayable

        boolean isPlayable()
        Return true iff the associated Position refers to an open token spot, or an open board. A board, in turn, is open iff no win has been acheived at its own field level and there is at least one (resursively) open position in its field.
